net.cnri.apps.doserver

Class HashDirectoryStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cnri.apps.doserver.AbstractStorage
      • net.cnri.apps.doserver.HashDirectoryStorage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RangeRequestStorage, Storage

    public class HashDirectoryStorage
extends AbstractStorage
implements RangeRequestStorage
    HashDirectoryStorage stores digital objects and associated data elements using the file system. In order to support ridiculously large numbers of digital objects on systems that have limited directory sizes, the digital object IDs are hashed into a hexadecimal form, of which every 4 digits represents a part of the path to the directory containing the digital object's data elements.

      • getObjectInfo

        public DOMetadata getObjectInfo(java.lang.String objectID,
                                DOMetadata metadata)
                         throws DOException
        Returns any known metadata for the digital object with the given identifier. If the given DOMetadata object is non-null then the metadata is stored in that object which is also returned. Otherwise, a new DOMetadata instance is constructed and returned. Note that this method returns a non-null value whether or not the object exists.

        public java.io.File getFileForDataElement(java.lang.String objectID,
                                          java.lang.String elementID)
                                   throws DOException
        Returns the File in which the given data element is stored, if any. This can return null on servers where data elements are not stored in files. This is used where operators need to do more with a data element than simple read and write operations. Examples inlude indexes, databases, etc.
